head.supplied: 16/6/96. ¶ ¶ Sorry, dear Mr Macdonald, to hear of your indisposition, but trust you will soon recover. I feel not much better, but could in the warmth of dayhours come to your office, where, I suppos...

div.p: A38, Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (Victorian Branch), Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

Sorry, dear Mr Macdonald, to hear of your indisposition, but trust you will soon recover. I feel not much better, but could in the warmth of dayhours come to your office, where, I suppose, you would allow us to hold the antarctic Committee meeting along with a full meeting of the geographic Council, when we all could meet Capt Gipps.
M to A. Macdonald, 2 June 1896mentions a letter from Captain Gipps, that evidently contained some policy proposal. No meeeting of the Council with him before M died in October has been identified.
I have in this sense forwarded your letter on to MrPotter, who doubtless will call on you and arrange for an early meeting
